alert.note: Alert for Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 6:44PM EDT until July 09 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including Anson and Stanly counties. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 644 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albemarle, Wadesboro, Badin Lake, Ansonville, Plyler, Polkton, Locust, Norwood, Badin, Oakboro, Stanfield, Richfield, New London, Lilesville, Morven, Peachland, McFarlan, Lake Tillery, White Store and Morrow Mountain State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
